title: Introducing Yourself
description: Learn basic phrases to introduce yourself and your role in the company.
objectives: State your name and job title
Use the verb 'to be' for personal identification

theorySlides.title: Basic Introductions
theorySlides.content:
When you meet someone for the first time, keep it simple:

- **I am [Name]** / **I'm [Name]**
- **My name is [Name]**
- **Nice to meet you!**

theorySlides.title: Talking About Your Role
theorySlides.content:
To talk about your job, use **I am a/an [Job Title]**:

- I am **an** assistant.
- I am **a** manager.
- I am **an** intern.

Note: Use 'an' before vowel sounds (a, e, i, o, u).

interactiveCheck.question: Choose the correct sentence:
interactiveCheck.explanation: 'Accountant' starts with a vowel sound, so we use 'an'.
